name: Bavette With Mojama
keywords: appetizer, main course, dried tuna, garlic, pasta, fall
recipeIngredient: 1 head radicchio, sliced into thin ribbons (about 4 cups)
2 ounces mojama, sliced paper-thin and julienned

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it liberally. Add the pasta and cook until al dente, 8 to 10 minutes.

When the pasta is almost ready, heat  1/4 cup of the olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Sauté the garlic, red pepper, radicchio and 1/4 teaspoon salt until just softened, about 2 minutes. Add a few tablespoons of the pasta water and reduce heat to low.

Reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water, drain the cooked pasta and add to the pan. Toss all of the ingredients together, folding in the lemon zest, the remaining olive oil and some of the pasta water if necessary. Divide the pasta among six warmed bowls, sprinkle evenly with the bread crumbs and mojama, and serve immediately.
